required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Impact of Altitude Level on Surgical Outcomes of Pancreaticoduodenectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Impact of Altitude Level on Surgical Outcomes of Pancreaticoduodenectomy for Periampullary Tumour (Multicenter Study)

brief_summary.textblock: Very few papers examine the effect of living at high altitudes on surgical results of major operations. This research is designed to determine the surgical outcomes of PD for periampullary tumour in high altitudes and normal altitudes.

detailed_description.textblock:
Many recent studies have suggested multiple risk factors affecting postoperative surgical outcomes of PD; THE research is designed to determine the surgical outcomes of PD for periampullary tumour in high altitudes and normal altitude.
it is a multicenter study Aseer central hospital, Saudia and from Egypt two centers Mansoura university and el Menia university

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: it is a multicenter study Aseer centeral hospital, saudia and from Egypt two centers mansoura university and el menia university The patients distributed into two groups group I (G1) PD underwent in the area at the level of the sea, normal altitude region, and group II (G2) PD underwent in high altitude region.

arm_group.description: PD underwent in the area at the level of the sea, normal altitude region
PD underwent in high altitude region.

intervention.description: dissection and removal of periampulary tumour with 3 reconstruction PJ, HJ, and GJ

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- periampulary tumour
Exclusion Criteria:
- liver cirrhosis,
- PG,
- advanced tumour,
- vascular resection

reference.citation: Dutta V, Singh R, Kumar S, Aggarwal N, Hari Kumar KVS. Profile of pulmonary embolism in service personnel posted at high altitude area. Indian Heart J. 2018 May - Jun;70(3):427-429. doi: 10.1016/j.ihj.2017.08.002. Epub 2017 Aug 18.

Prabhakar A, Chatterjee T, Bajaj N, Tyagi T, Sahu A, Gupta N, Kumari B, Nair V, Kumar B, Ashraf MZ. Venous thrombosis at altitude presents with distinct biochemical profiles: a comparative study from the Himalayas to the plains. patient_data.ipd_description: it will be available for other researchers
